channel.title: My laggy server
channel.description: Ok, I have gotten a server and I had 34 people on it yesterday. Why is it that every one says they can barrely move without a lag? Can someone please post how to get a server source that can hold at least 100 people ( does it have to do with your internet connection?) Because I got a 100 bps dsl signal... So if any one know's, please post.

item.title: My laggy server
item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice
item.description:
@Zombiedevice wrote:

Dude I have a brand new labtop… Vista and 1 g Memory, it’s not that.

I also have a desktop and I’m going to try useing it to host it today. If that doesn’t work I will try cleaning out client.java…

Read full topic

item.title: My laggy server
item.dc:creator: @webbsta webbsta
item.description:
@webbsta wrote:

you probably don’t have a 100mb/s connection, you are probably looking at the LAN(local area network) connection (connection from your computer to your dsl). i get a bubble telling me my connection speed when i connect. it is probably your laptop that is slowing down the server. to be able to hold 100 people on the server you would probably need something like 1 gb memory and 1 of the newest processors.

paying for server hosting could become very expensive + you would need to transfer all the files to ur shell or dedi server and they are probably running the servers on linux and u would then need a linux compiler etc, etc. its probably more hassle than its worth :S

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice
item.description:
@Zombiedevice wrote:

I’m useing a labtop, and yes that is a very fast connection. I think it’s the client.java being to big? I want to remove the clue stuff at the button but I don’t know how, I always get errors… I’m useing darknesscape pk source, it’s non silab, and it stinks…

item.title: My laggy server
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

  1. You have a 0.01kB/s connection? ((100/8)/1024)
  2. If you connection is actually good, whcih I’m guessing you meant 100mb/s, then it is the server/your pc.

Want a way to fix it? Learn Java, start from scratch, don’t use thread per client.

Read full topic
